metadata.dc:author: de Julián Jiménez, A
Jiménez Rodríguez, A
Fernández Guerrero, M L
de Górgolas Hernández-Mora, M
González Cajigal, R
metadata.dc:description: Fever of unknown origin (FUO) has been rarely associated with colonic cancer. In less than 1% of cases of FUO a colonic cancer is found as the main cause of fever. The authors reviewed 4 cases of colonic cancer whose first manifestation was FUO. Recurrent episodes of brief, self-limited fever, without a characteristic pattern, may be the first symptom of colonic cancer. On occassions, E. coli bacteremia may be the herald of an occult colonic malignancy.
metadata.dc:title: Fiebre recurrente como primera manifestación del cáncer de colon.
[Recurrent fever as presenting from of colon carcinoma].
